visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts column chart that visualizes the layers of Earth's atmosphere. The chart should have a title 'Earth's atmosphere' and a subtitle with a link to a NASA source. The x-axis should be hidden, and the y-axis should also be hidden with a minimum value of 0. The chart should use a stacking mode of 'percent' for the columns, and data labels should be enabled with specific formatting to display the series name and height. The tooltip should display additional information about each layer. The legend should be disabled, and custom colors should be applied to the series.

series.name: Exosphere
series.info:
This is the upper limit of our atmosphere.
It extends from the top of the thermosphere up to 10,000 km (6,200 mi).

series.name: Ionosphere
series.info:
The ionosphere is an abundant layer of electrons and ionized atoms and molecules
that stretches from about 48 kilometers (30 miles) above
the surface to the edge of space at about 965 km (600 mi)

series.name: Thermosphere
series.info:
The thermosphere starts just above the mesosphere
and extends to 600 kilometers (372 miles) high

series.name: Mesosphere
series.info:
The mesosphere starts just above the stratosphere
and extends to 85 kilometers (53 miles) high

series.name: Stratosphere
series.info:
The stratosphere starts just above the troposphere
and extends to 50 kilometers (31 miles) high

series.name: Troposphere
series.info:
The troposphere starts at the Earth's surface
and extends 8 to 14.5 kilometers high (5 to 9 miles)

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts configuration is designed to render a column chart that visualizes the layers of Earth's atmosphere. The chart type is set to 'column', and it includes a title and subtitle with a link to a NASA source. The x-axis and y-axis are both hidden, with the y-axis having a minimum value of 0. The chart uses a stacking mode of 'percent' for the columns, which allows the layers to be stacked on top of each other in a percentage format. Data labels are enabled and formatted to display the series name and height, with black text and no text outline. The tooltip is customized to display additional information about each layer when hovered over. The legend is disabled, and custom colors are applied to the series, as specified in the Highcharts.setOptions call. This configuration effectively visualizes the layers of the atmosphere in a clear and informative manner.
